citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a new thermophilic and autotrophic methane producing bacterium: Methanobacterium thermoaggregans spec. nov.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium thermoaggregans sp. nov.
Methanobacterium thermoaggregans ((ther.mo.ag'gre.gans) Gr. adj. thermus hot; L. part. adj. aggregans aggregating, clumping; thermoaggregans thermophilic and aggregate-forming)

Morphology: Gram-negative regular rods, mostly occurring in filaments and aggregates; single cells are 4-8 μm in length and 0.4 μm in diameter; cells are nonmotile, showing ultrastructural diversity (intracytoplasmic membranes).
DNA base composition: 42 mol% G + C Temperature relationship: Optimum at 65°C range 40-75°C.
pH relationship: Optimum near 7.0- 7.5; growth occurs between 6.5 and 9.0.
Physiology: Obligately anaerobic; H2 + CO2 serve as the only substrate for growth and CH4 formation.
Nutrition: Grows autotrophically in defined mineral medium with H2 + CO2.
Yeast extract stimulates growth but is not required.
Source: Mud from a cattle pasture.
Type strain: Methanobacterium thermoaggregans has been deposited in the German culture collection (DSM), Göttingen, FRG, number 3266.
